page.title: 17Local History: Characters
page.content: The best known historical character associated with the area is Amy Robsart wife of Robert Dudley, Earl of Leicester. She died at Cumnor Place. "Did she fall or was she pushed?" Her death was convenient for her husband who sought to become the husband of Queen Elizabeth I. The mystery, which is the subject of Sir Walter Scott's novel "Kenilworth" has never been solved. The hill between Cumnor and Farmoor is known as "Tumbledown Dick". Tradition has it that it was named for Oliver Cromwell's son Richard, who was almost certainly in this area during the Civil War, but no specific evidence has been found to link him with Cumnor.
